response: "{ \"title\": \"Harshad Number Checker\", \"description\": \"A Harshad number, also known as a Niven number, is an integer that is divisible by the sum of its digits. For example, 18 is a Harshad number because it can be divided by the sum of its digits (9). Write a function `is_harshad` that checks if a given integer is a Harshad number.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef is_harshad(n: int) -> bool:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `n` (int): An integer to be checked for being a Harshad number.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns `True` if the input integer is a Harshad number, `False` otherwise.\\n\", \"code\": \"def is_harshad(n: int) -> bool:\\n    sum_of_digits = 0\\n    for digit in str(n):\\n        sum_of_digits += int(digit)\\n    return n % sum_of_digits == 0,\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert is_harshad(18) == True\", \"assert is_harshad(19) == False\", \"assert is_harshad(12) == True\", \"assert is_harshad(1234) == False\"] }"
